abstract: Solar thermal plants can store and use sun's energy even after sunset, but developers like Spanish company Abengoa do not have plans to build more plants in United States due to uncertainty over important tax credit worth 30 percent of project's cost; subsidy, known as Investment Tax Credit, is only scheduled to remain in place until end of 2016, when it will fall to 10 percent.
lead_paragraph: New solar-plant technology can store and use the sun’s heat for energy even after sunset, but the coming expiration of federal tax credits has put further construction of such facilities in doubt.
snippet: New solar-plant technology can store and use the sun’s heat for energy even after sunset, but the coming expiration of federal tax credits has put further construction of such facilities in doubt.

headline.main: Worry for Solar Projects After End of Tax Credits
headline.print_headline: Worry for Solar Projects After End of Tax Credits
